text: Is there a way to determine what scopes are necessary?

Also, i think support should be directed at skyvia — they are requiring a scope that HubSpot is saying isn’t available. Just because you haven’t had a change to your HS license doesn’t mean that skyvia (or whatever app you are using) hasn’t updated their code and made a change to their api calls,

you want to use the schemas api to get all the information you need to help with the associations api. the associations api is where you can connect the objects.

the short of it — look up contact. Then you need to look up how to get the objects associated with that <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>, the Association schema endpoints tab will be helpful for that

You have to get teh assocations — you can’t just look it up with the object search.. see the link below
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

Actually, it goes beyond Skyvia.  When I attempt to reach the QUOTES object via Devart (another tool) I am receiving a similar type error.

NULLValueHandling property specified was not found.
Is there any way for you to show me the url/payload and the full response?
